013package org.apache.juneau.http.header;
014
015import java.util.function.*;
016
017import org.apache.juneau.*;
018import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
019import org.apache.juneau.httppart.*;
020import org.apache.juneau.oapi.*;
021import org.apache.juneau.serializer.*;
022
023/**
024 * TODO
025 *
026 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
027 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestCommonBasics">juneau-rest-common Basics</a>
028 * </ul>
029 *
030 * @serial exclude
031 */
032public class SerializedHeader extends BasicHeader {
033
034   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
035   // Static
036   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
037
038   private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
039
040   /**
041    * Static creator.
042    *
043    * @param name The header name.
044    * @param value
045    *    The POJO to serialize as the header value.
046    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
047    * @return A new header bean, or <jk>null</jk> if the value is <jk>null</jk>.
048    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
049    */
050   public static SerializedHeader of(String name, Object value) {
051      return new SerializedHeader(name, value, null, null, false);
052   }
053
054   /**
055    * Static creator with delayed value.
056    *
057    * <p>
058    * Header value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link #getValue()}.
059    *
060    * @param name The header name.
061    * @param value
062    *    The supplier of the POJO to serialize as the header value.
063    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
064    * @return A new header bean, or <jk>null</jk> if the value is <jk>null</jk>.
065    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
066    */
067   public static SerializedHeader of(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
068      return new SerializedHeader(name, value, null, null, false);
069   }
070
071   /**
072    * Static creator.
073    *
074    * @param name The HTTP header name name.
075    * @param value
076    *    The POJO to serialize as the header value.
077    * @param serializer
078    *    The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string value.
079    * @param schema
080    *    The schema object that defines the format of the output.
081    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, defaults to the schema defined on the serializer.
082    *    <br>If that's also <jk>null</jk>, defaults to {@link HttpPartSchema#DEFAULT}.
083    *    <br>Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. {@link OpenApiSerializer}).
084    *    <br>Can also be a {@link Supplier}.
085    * @param skipIfEmpty If value is a blank string, the value should return as <jk>null</jk>.
086    * @return A new header bean, or <jk>null</jk> if the value is <jk>null</jk>.
087    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
088    */
089   public static SerializedHeader of(String name, Object value, HttpPartSerializerSession serializer, HttpPartSchema schema, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
090      return new SerializedHeader(name, value, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty);
091   }
092
093   /**
094    * Static creator with delayed value.
095    *
096    * <p>
097    * Header value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link #getValue()}.
098    *
099    * @param name The HTTP header name name.
100    * @param value
101    *    The supplier of the POJO to serialize as the header value.
102    * @param serializer
103    *    The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string value.
104    * @param schema
105    *    The schema object that defines the format of the output.
106    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, defaults to the schema defined on the serializer.
107    *    <br>If that's also <jk>null</jk>, defaults to {@link HttpPartSchema#DEFAULT}.
108    *    <br>Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. {@link OpenApiSerializer}).
109    *    <br>Can also be a {@link Supplier}.
110    * @param skipIfEmpty If value is a blank string, the value should return as <jk>null</jk>.
111    * @return A new header bean, or <jk>null</jk> if the value is <jk>null</jk>.
112    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
113    */
114   public static SerializedHeader of(String name, Supplier<?> value, HttpPartSerializerSession serializer, HttpPartSchema schema, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
115      return new SerializedHeader(name, value, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty);
116   }
117
118   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
119   // Instance
120   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
121
122   private final Object value;
123   private final Supplier<Object> supplier;
124   private HttpPartSerializerSession serializer;
125   private HttpPartSchema schema = HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT;
126   private boolean skipIfEmpty;
127
128   /**
129    * Constructor.
130    *
131    * @param name The HTTP header name name.
132    * @param value The POJO to serialize to the parameter value.
133    * @param serializer
134    *    The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string value.
135    * @param schema
136    *    The schema object that defines the format of the output.
137    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, defaults to the schema defined on the serializer.
138    *    <br>If that's also <jk>null</jk>, defaults to {@link HttpPartSchema#DEFAULT}.
139    *    <br>Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. {@link OpenApiSerializer}).
140    *    <br>Can also be a {@link Supplier}.
141    * @param skipIfEmpty If value is a blank string, the value should return as <jk>null</jk>.
142    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
143    */
144   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
145   public SerializedHeader(String name, Object value, HttpPartSerializerSession serializer, HttpPartSchema schema, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
146      super(name, null);
147      this.value = value instanceof Supplier ? null : value;
148      this.supplier = value instanceof Supplier ? (Supplier<Object>)value : null;
149      this.serializer = serializer;
150      this.schema = schema;
151      this.skipIfEmpty = skipIfEmpty;
152   }
153
154   /**
155    * Constructor with delayed value.
156    *
157    * <p>
158    * Header value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link #getValue()}.
159    *
160    * @param name The HTTP header name name.
161    * @param value The supplier of the POJO to serialize to the parameter value.
162    * @param serializer
163    *    The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string value.
164    * @param schema
165    *    The schema object that defines the format of the output.
166    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, defaults to the schema defined on the serializer.
167    *    <br>If that's also <jk>null</jk>, defaults to {@link HttpPartSchema#DEFAULT}.
168    *    <br>Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. {@link OpenApiSerializer}).
169    *    <br>Can also be a {@link Supplier}.
170    * @param skipIfEmpty If value is a blank string, the value should return as <jk>null</jk>.
171    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
172    */
173   public SerializedHeader(String name, Supplier<Object> value, HttpPartSerializerSession serializer, HttpPartSchema schema, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
174      super(name, null);
175      this.value = null;
176      this.supplier = value;
177      this.serializer = serializer;
178      this.schema = schema;
179      this.skipIfEmpty = skipIfEmpty;
180   }
181
182   /**
183    * Copy constructor.
184    *
185    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
186    */
187   protected SerializedHeader(SerializedHeader copyFrom) {
188      super(copyFrom);
189      this.value = copyFrom.value;
190      this.supplier = copyFrom.supplier;
191      this.serializer = copyFrom.serializer == null ? serializer : copyFrom.serializer;
192      this.schema = copyFrom.schema == null ? schema : copyFrom.schema;
193      this.skipIfEmpty = copyFrom.skipIfEmpty;
194   }
195
196   /**
197    * Creates a copy of this object.
198    *
199    * @return A new copy of this object.
200    */
201   public SerializedHeader copy() {
202      return new SerializedHeader(this);
203   }
204
205   /**
206    * Sets the serializer to use for serializing the value to a string value.
207    *
208    * @param value The new value for this property.
209    * @return This object.
210    */
211   public SerializedHeader serializer(HttpPartSerializer value) {
212      if (value != null)
213         return serializer(value.getPartSession());
214      return this;
215   }
216
217   /**
218    * Sets the serializer to use for serializing the value to a string value.
219    *
220    * @param value The new value for this property.
221    * @return This object.
222    */
223   public SerializedHeader serializer(HttpPartSerializerSession value) {
224      serializer = value;
225      return this;
226   }
227
228   /**
229    * Sets the schema object that defines the format of the output.
230    *
231    * @param value The new value for this property.
232    * @return This object.
233    */
234   public SerializedHeader schema(HttpPartSchema value) {
235      this.schema = value;
236      return this;
237   }
238
239   /**
240    * Copies this bean and sets the serializer and schema on it.
241    *
242    * @param serializer The new serializer for the bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
243    * @param schema The new schema for the bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
244    * @return Either a new bean with the serializer set, or this bean if
245    *    both values are <jk>null</jk> or the serializer and schema were already set.
246    */
247   public SerializedHeader copyWith(HttpPartSerializerSession serializer, HttpPartSchema schema) {
248      if ((this.serializer == null && serializer != null) || (this.schema == null && schema != null)) {
249         SerializedHeader h = copy();
250         if (serializer != null)
251            h.serializer(serializer);
252         if (schema != null)
253            h.schema(schema);
254         return h;
255      }
256      return this;
257   }
258
259   /**
260    * Don't serialize this header if the value is <jk>null</jk> or an empty string.
261    *
262    * @return This object.
263    */
264   public SerializedHeader skipIfEmpty() {
265      return skipIfEmpty(true);
266   }
267
268   /**
269    * Don't serialize this header if the value is <jk>null</jk> or an empty string.
270    *
271    * @param value The new value of this setting.
272    * @return This object.
273    */
274   public SerializedHeader skipIfEmpty(boolean value) {
275      this.skipIfEmpty = value;
276      return this;
277   }
278
279   @Override /* NameValuePair */
280   public String getValue() {
281      try {
282         Object v = value;
283         if (supplier != null)
284            v = supplier.get();
285         HttpPartSchema schema = this.schema == null ? HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT : this.schema;
286         String def = schema.getDefault();
287         if (v == null) {
288            if ((def == null && ! schema.isRequired()) || (def == null && schema.isAllowEmptyValue()))
289               return null;
290         }
291         if (Utils.isEmpty(Utils.s(v)) && skipIfEmpty && def == null)
292            return null;
293         return serializer == null ? Utils.s(v) : serializer.serialize(HttpPartType.HEADER, schema, v);
294      } catch (SchemaValidationException e) {
295         throw new BasicRuntimeException(e, "Validation error on request {0} parameter ''{1}''=''{2}''", HttpPartType.HEADER, getName(), value);
296      } catch (SerializeException e) {
297         throw new BasicRuntimeException(e, "Serialization error on request {0} parameter ''{1}''", HttpPartType.HEADER, getName());
298      }
299   }
300}
